title: NIPS_2015_18_abs

sentences.text: Many practical modeling problems involve discrete data that are best represented as draws from multinomial or categorical distributions .
For example , nucleotides in a DNA sequence , children 's names in a given state and year , and text documents are all commonly modeled with multinomial distributions .

In all of these cases , we expect some form of dependency between the draws : the nucleotide at one position in the DNA strand may depend on the preceding nucleotides , children 's names are highly correlated from year to year , and topics in text may be correlated and dynamic .
These dependencies are not naturally captured by the typical Dirichlet-multinomial formulation .

Here , we leverage a logistic stick-breaking representation and recent innovations in Pólya-gamma augmentation to reformu-late the multinomial distribution in terms of latent variables with jointly Gaussian likelihoods , enabling us to take advantage of a host of Bayesian inference techniques for Gaussian models with minimal overhead .

summary: Many practical modeling problems involve discrete data that are best represented as draws from multinomial or categorical distributions . For example , nucleotides in a DNA sequence , children 's names in a given state and year , and text documents are all commonly modeled with multinomial distributions . In all of these cases , we expect some form of dependency between the draws : the nucleotide at one position in the DNA strand may depend on the preceding nucleotides , children 's names are highly correlated from year to year , and topics in text may be correlated and dynamic . These dependencies are not naturally captured by the typical Dirichlet-multinomial formulation . Here , we leverage a logistic stick-breaking representation and recent innovations in Pólya-gamma augmentation to reformu-late the multinomial distribution in terms of latent variables with jointly Gaussian likelihoods , enabling us to take advantage of a host of Bayesian inference techniques for Gaussian models with minimal overhead .

Predicate-involve.label: involve
Predicate-involve.description: To involve means to necessitate the presence of a particular characteristic, property, or aspect within something. It implies that the subject has an inherent connection with the object, which cannot be fully understood without considering its relationship to the object.

Predicate-represent.label: represent
Predicate-represent.description: To represent means to convey a likeness or correspondence between two entities, where one entity (the subject) serves as an abstraction or model for another entity (the object). This predicate implies that there exists a meaningful connection or mapping between the subject and the object, allowing us to understand, describe, or analyze the object in terms of the subject.

Predicate-modeled_with.label: modeled with
Predicate-modeled_with.description: The predicate 'modeled with' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject's characteristics are represented using the concept or framework described by the object. This implies that the subject has been conceptualized, simulated, or approximated according to the principles or patterns embodied in the object.

Predicate-leverage.label: leverage
Predicate-leverage.description: To utilize or capitalize on a resource, technique, or concept to achieve an advantage, improve performance, or enhance understanding. The predicate 'leverage' indicates that the subject exploits or makes use of the object to gain some benefit.

Predicate-reformulate.label: reformulate
Predicate-reformulate.description: To reorganize and express a concept, idea, or representation in a new form that captures its essential characteristics while potentially simplifying or clarifying it.

Predicate-are.label: are
Predicate-are.description: The predicate 'are' indicates a state of being or existence between the subject and object. It suggests that there is an inherent connection, relationship, or correspondence between them.

Predicate-enable.label: enable
Predicate-enable.description: The predicate 'enable' indicates a relationship where the subject has the capacity or authority to make something possible or effective. In this context, it suggests that the subject's presence, properties, or characteristics allow the object to exist, function, or have an impact in some way.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is related to or encompasses the object as a more general concept. It suggests a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject represents a higher-level category and the object represents a lower-level instance or subcategory.
